title: M&A funding norms open up a $15-b opportunity for banks
summary: New Reserve Bank of India guidelines liberalize merger and acquisition financing, allowing Indian banks to fund up to 75% of acquisition costs with a 3:1 debt-equity ratio. This unlocks a potential $10-15 billion annual opportunity for domestic lenders, previously dominated by offshore entities, fostering a new, high-value asset class.

title: Unique transaction ID to be must for OTC derivatives deals: RBI
summary: The Reserve Bank of India will mandate unique transaction identifiers (UTIs) for all over-the-counter derivative trades starting January 1, 2027. This move aims to enhance traceability and risk monitoring for instruments like FX and interest rate derivatives.  Market participants must upgrade systems for compliance, with CCIL expected to provide operational guidelines soon.

title: Lunar New Year 2026: Why does China market shudown hurt silver prices more than gold? Explained
summary: Silver prices have seen volatility this week as key Asian markets close for the Lunar New Year. The lack of trading liquidity, especially from China, has intensified price swings, highlighting silver's vulnerability as an industrial metal compared to gold's more stable demand.

title: FPI ownership in NSE-listed firms shrinks to 15.5-year low after record $18.9 billion outflow
summary: Fueled by strong SIP inflows in mutual funds, domestic institutional investors' share rose to 19%, surpassing FPIs. Mutual funds' holdings reached an all-time high of 11.1%, demonstrating local investor power.

title: PNGS Reva Diamond Jewellery IPO GMP in focus: Check what grey market signals ahead of offer launch next week
summary: PNGS Reva Diamond Jewellery IPO GMP today is  ₹16. At the current GMP, PNGS Reva Diamond Jewellery IPO listing price could be  ₹402, a premium of 4.15% over its upper end of the price range of  ₹386.

title: Crypto firm CoinDCX announces  ₹111 crore ESOP buyback for employees — full details here
summary: CoinDCX has launched an ESOP buyback worth  ₹111 crore for over 500 employees, both current and former, allowing them to cash in on their stock options.&nbsp;

title: Weekly Top Picks: These stocks scored 10 on 10 on Stock Reports Plus
summary: Stock Reports Plus, powered by Refinitiv, undertakes detailed company analysis for 4,000+ listed stocks. In addition to detailed company analyses, the report also collates analysts’ forecasts and trend analysis for each component. An average score in Stock Reports Plus is calculated by undertaking quantitative analysis of five key investment tools – earnings, fundamentals, relative valuation, risk, and price momentum.

title: Tata Steel among 5 stocks that hit 52-week highs and rallied up to 10% in a month
summary: Despite the Sensex plunging 1,236 points to 82,498, five BSE 100 stocks touched fresh 52-week highs. Indus Towers, Tata Steel, Eicher Motors, Bajaj Auto and Marico showed strong momentum, signaling investor confidence and potential for further upside amid broader market weakness.

title: Gainers & Losers: Tata Investment, Newgen among 8 stocks that moved most on Thursday
summary: Indian equity markets tumbled as US-Iran tensions triggered broad-based selling. Select stocks like Newgen, Netweb and Tata Investment gained.

title: Stock Radar: Cummins India stock hits record highs in February 2026 – time to buy the dip or book profits?
summary: Cummins India Ltd hit a fresh record high in February 2026, breaking out of a multi-month consolidation. With strong momentum, bullish indicators, and support across key moving averages, analysts expect the stock to move toward ₹4,970, with support seen near ₹4,300.

title: Vedanta trades at discount to peers; well placed to benefit from strong aluminium prices, says Kotak Securities
summary: Aluminium prices declined to $3,030 per ton, impacted by a strong dollar and increased inventories. Kotak Securities forecasts a structural deficit in the market through FY2028E, predicting demand growth primarily from ex-China markets, with Vedanta positioned favourably.

title: Macquarie flags ESOP costs, revenue concentration concerns over PhonePe IPO
summary: Macquarie raises concerns about PhonePe's ESOP costs and revenue concentration ahead of its IPO. High ESOP expenses impact EBITDA margins, and regulatory changes could reduce revenues by 20-25%. PhonePe's upcoming IPO includes an offer-for-sale of shares.

title: LIC Mutual Fund NFO opens tomorrow: Price, date, review, and other details in 10 points
summary: LIC MF Technology Fund aims to allocate capital across a wide spectrum of technology-driven sectors, including semiconductor–linked companies, data centre operators, digital commerce platforms, internet businesses, and emerging technology enterprises.

title: Markets signalling a broader base for upside; positive on financials, says Devarsh Vakil of HDFC Securities
summary: Devarsh Vakil of HDFC Securities emphasises the importance of asset allocation and a long-term focus in investing. With the Indian market showing signs of recovery and sectors poised for growth, he advises on strategies to manage risk and capitalise on opportunities for 2026.

title: United Breweries bags registration for iconic Kingfisher jingle ‘Oo la la la la le o’ — Here's what you need to know
summary: United Breweries bagged the registration for the iconic Kingfisher jingle ‘Oo la la la la le o’ after the Trade Marks Registry found there was no identical or similar sound mark. Here's what you need to know.&nbsp;

title: Market Trading Guide: ONGC among 2 stocks to buy on Friday for up to 16% returns
summary: Nifty ended sharply lower as US-Iran tensions sparked a broad sell-off, breaking its three-day gain streak. Stock picks include ONGC and Biocon, showing strong bullish momentum on short-term charts. Traders are advised to follow breakout levels with prudent stop-losses.

title: Gold, silver rates today: Comex gold jumps $31/oz; silver gains $2/oz on rising geopolitical tensions
summary: Investors continued to seek precious metals amid rising geopolitical tensions, with gold prices hitting an intraday high of $5,040. The Fed's conflicting views on interest rates add to market uncertainty, while silver also shows gains.

title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide stock market action on Friday
summary: Indian markets fell sharply as US-Iran tensions triggered broad selling. Nifty dropped 365 points below key moving averages, with auto, financials, IT, and consumer stocks leading losses. India VIX surged, signaling heightened volatility and potential further downside.

title: War clouds in West Asia slam market, Nifty plunges most since budget
summary: The trade deal with the US is done, almost. But there are new clouds on the horizon. The US has massed its forces in the Persian Gulf as it closes in on a strike on Iran. An attack could damage market badly, as investors fear a possible closure of the Strait of Hormuz

title: Amazon surpasses Walmart to become largest company by revenue with $717 billion — Here's what you need to know
summary: Amazon surpassed Walmart to become the largest company in terms of revenue. The company's revenue from operations was $717 billion for the fiscal year ending December 2025. Here's what you need to know.&nbsp;

title: These large- and mid-cap stocks can give more than 25% return in 1 year, according to analysts
summary: Given multiple issues that have suddenly come up, there is a high probability that the market will remain volatile. But history tells us that both good and bad sentiment have a limited shelf life. What is permanent for and in the market is earnings. And that is determined by fundamentals. Yes, there are many sectors where the fundamentals are changing and, hence, a round of valuation readjustment is bound to happen. So, at this point of time, rather than focusing on whether the Nifty is going up or down, think long-term and focus on the fundamentals of a sector or company.
